intro: Microseris stenocarpha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed scabious, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and are arranged in loose clusters. Microseris stenocarpha is known for its resilience in arid environments and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub ecosystems.
